file_name.description: File path to the data file. This should be a valid file path relative to the root of the dataset.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the data was created or last modified. This should be in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: Description of the data file. This should provide a brief overview of the contents of the file.

file_type.description: Type of the data file. This should be the extension of the data file, such as .txt, .csv, .json, etc.

items.description: Each ID should be taken from the subject.xlsx, samples.xlsx, sites.xlsx, or performances.xlsx files.

entity.description: A list of the entity IDs that this file is associated with.

data_modality.description: Modality of the data. This should describe the type of data contained in the file, such as 'image', 'text', 'audio', etc.

also_in_dataset.description: DOI to the dataset this data is also part of.

also_in_dataset_path.description: Path to the dataset that this data file is part of. This should be a valid file path in the system where the manifest is being used.

data_dictionary_path.description: Path to the data dictionary for this data file. This should be a valid file path in the system where the manifest is being used.

entity_is_transitive.description: Indicates whether the entity represented in this data file is transitive. This should be either true or false.

additional_metadata.description: Additional metadata about the data file. This can include any other relevant information that does not fit into the other categories.
